markingPoints.Teacher Expectation: Calculates the product of the zeroes (   ).

markingPoints.Teacher Expectation: Forms the quadratic polynomial by substituting the calculated sum and product into the standard form k(x^2 - (sum)x + (product)).
markingPoints.Pass if: Correctly substitutes the sum and product to form the polynomial k(x^2 - (3/5)x - 14/5) or an equivalent form (e.g., x^2 - (3/5)x - 14/5 assuming k=1).
markingPoints.Fail if: Incorrectly substitutes the sum/product or uses the wrong polynomial formula.
markingPoints.guidance: Award A1 for forming the correct polynomial using the sum and product, soi. ft from steps 2 and 3 if applicable. oe.

Question_specific_notes: Students may use either method. Ensure that the final polynomial is simplified. Accept equivalent forms of the polynomial, e.g., by multiplying by a constant factor.
